titleStmt.title: A loving salutation to the seed of Abraham among the Jewes: where ever they are scattered up and down upon the face of the earth. And to the seed of Abraham among all people upon the face of the earth; which are all out of the way ... And the way of truth opened to them, which is the way of holinesse ... where the uncleane cannot passe, bnt [sic] is for the ransomed and redeemed to returne to Zion ... Thus saith the Lord thy redeemer ... By M.F.
titleStmt.author: Fox, Margaret Askew Fell, 1614-1702.

titleStmt.title: A loving salutation to the seed of Abraham among the Jewes: where ever they are scattered up and down upon the face of the earth. And to the seed of Abraham among all people upon the face of the earth; which are all out of the way ... And the way of truth opened to them, which is the way of holinesse ... where the uncleane cannot passe, bnt [sic] is for the ransomed and redeemed to returne to Zion ... Thus saith the Lord thy redeemer ... By M.F.
titleStmt.author: Fox, Margaret Askew Fell, 1614-1702.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Tho. Simmons at the signe of the Bull and Mouth near Aldersgate,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "octob: 30"; second 6 in imprint date written over with "7".
Reproductions of the originals Harvard University Library (Early English books) and in the British Library (Thomason Tracts).
